2024-2025 Shepherd University Catalog

Environmental Studies Comprehensive, B.S.

Print-Friendly Page (opens a new window)
Facebook this Page (opens a new window)
Tweet this Page (opens a new window)

Environmental Studies is an interdisciplinary program that investigates interactions between humans and their environment. This includes physical and biological aspects in addition to the highly modified human-made environments such as urban and agricultural systems. The Comprehensive Environmental Studies major provides students an integrative foundation in biology, physical sciences, technologies, earth systems and humanities and social sciences needed to understand interactions between humans and their environment. Students also complete a concentration in Environmental Science, Aquatic Sciences, or Sustainable Agriculture and Resource Management.

Curriculum for a Comprehensive Major in Environmental Studies, B.S.

Environmental Core Requirements, 12 Hours:

  • ENVS 201 - Foundations In Environmental Science I (3cr)
  • ENVS 201L - Foundations In Environmental Science I Lab (1cr)
  • ENVS 202 - Foundations In Environmental Science II (3cr)
  • ENVS 202L - Foundations In Environmental Science II Lab (1cr)
  • ENVS 462 - Environmental Capstone (4cr)

Portfolio Requirement for Environmental Studies Major:

It is required that each major complete a portfolio prior to graduation. See advisor for specific details.

Curriculum for a Comprehensive Major in Environmental Studies, Environmental Science Concentration, 75-76 Hours:

The environmental science concentration is designed to prepare the student for a future in scientific study of the environment, with the broad range of topics covered providing the student with perspective on the numerous parameters environmental scientists must consider in their work. Skills necessary for employment in the environmental field and graduate study are important components of this concentration.

 

In addition to the Environmental Core and Portfolio Requirements, above, students will complete the following:

 

Additional Required Courses, 19-20 Hours:

  • GSCI 301 - Physical Geology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 306 - Environmental Policy (4cr)
  • ENVS 390 - Geographic Information Systems (4 cr)
  • ENVS 401 - Conservation Ecology (4cr)

  •  

  • MATH 314 - Statistics (3 cr)
  • OR  MATH 207 - Calculus I (4 cr)

Elective Courses, 32 Hours:

Complementary Sciences, 8 Hours:

Choose one sequence:

  • BIOL 211 - Fundamentals of Biology I: Molecular and Cellular Function (4cr)
  • AND  BIOL 212 - Fundamentals of Biology II: Diversity of Life (4cr)

  • OR

  • CHEM 207 - General Chemistry I (3 cr)
  • AND  CHEM 207L - General Chemistry I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • AND  CHEM 209 - General Chemistry II (3 cr)
  • AND  CHEM 209L - General Chemistry II Laboratory (1 cr)

  • OR

  • PHYS 201 - College Physics I (3 cr)
  • AND  PHYS 201L - College Physics I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • AND  PHYS 202 - College Physics II (3 cr)
  • AND  PHYS 202L - College Physics II Laboratory (1 cr)

  • OR

  • PHYS 221 - General Physics I (3 cr)
  • AND  PHYS 221L - General Physics I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • AND  PHYS 222 - General Physics II (3 cr)
  • AND  PHYS 222L - General Physics II Laboratory (1 cr)

Environmental Biology Electives, 8 Hours:

Choose two:

  • ENVS 300 - Integrated Pest Management and Lab (4 cr)
  • ENVS 301 - Wildlife Management and Lab (4 cr)
  • ENVS 302 - Forestry Management and Laboratory (4 cr)
  • ENVS 340 - Sustainable Agriculture and Lab (4 cr)
  • ENVS 343 - Aquatic Entomology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 344 - Ichthyology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 362 - Soil Science and Lab (4 cr)
  • ENVS 422 - Stream Ecology (4 cr)

Physical Electives, 8 Hours:

Choose two:

  • ENVS 309 - Geomorphology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 342 - Limnology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 441 - Hydrology and Lab (4 cr)
  • GSCI 303 - Meteorology (4 cr)
  • GSCI 306 - Introduction to Oceanography and Laboratory (4 cr)

Applied and Technical Electives, 8 Hours:

Choose two:

  • ENVS 345 - Sustainable Development and Laboratory (4 cr)
  • ENVS 396 - Photogrammetry and Aerial Systems (4 cr)
  • ENVS 397 - Advanced GIS and Remote Sensing (4cr)
  • PHYS 301 - Energy (4cr)
  • PHYS 302 - Physical Computing (4cr)

Additional Required Electives, 8 Hours:

  • Choose any two 300-level or above ENVS, GSCI, or PHYS courses.  This excludes ENVS 392 and ENVS 461.

Four-Year Course Progression

Environmental Science Concentration

Curriculum for a Comprehensive Major in Environmental Studies: Aquatic Science Concentration, 75-82 Hours:

The aquatic science concentration provides training in the practical skills required to directly enter employment in industry, consulting firms, or government in positions where practitioners monitor or restore aquatic habitats. In addition, the aquatic science concentration would prepare students who plan to pursue graduate studies in a diverse range of disciplines such as aquaculture, fisheries management, and ecology.

In addition to the Environmental Core and Portfolio Requirements, above, students will complete the following:

Concentration requirements, 48-54 Hours:

  • BIOL 211 - Fundamentals of Biology I: Molecular and Cellular Function (4cr)
  • AND  BIOL 212 - Fundamentals of Biology II: Diversity of Life (4cr)


  •  

  • MATH 205 - Calculus With Applications (4 cr)
  • OR  MATH 314 - Statistics (3 cr)

  •  

  • ENVS 306 - Environmental Policy (4cr)
  • ENVS 390 - Geographic Information Systems (4 cr)
  • ENVS 401 - Conservation Ecology (4cr)
  • ENVS 441 - Hydrology and Lab (4 cr)
  • ENVS 461 - Environmental Research (1-6cr)
  • GSCI 301 - Physical Geology (4 cr)

  •  

  • CHEM 207 - General Chemistry I (3 cr)
  • CHEM 207L - General Chemistry I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 209 - General Chemistry II (3 cr)
  • CHEM 209L - General Chemistry II Laboratory (1 cr)

  •  

  • PHYS 201 - College Physics I (3 cr)
  • PHYS 201L - College Physics I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • PHYS 202 - College Physics II (3 cr)
  • PHYS 202L - College Physics II Laboratory (1 cr)


  • OR
     

  • PHYS 221 - General Physics I (3 cr)
  • PHYS 221L - General Physics I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • PHYS 222 - General Physics II (3 cr)
  • PHYS 222L - General Physics II Laboratory (1 cr)

Aquatic ecology electives, 12 Hours

 Complete three from the following:

  • ENVS 342 - Limnology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 343 - Aquatic Entomology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 344 - Ichthyology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 422 - Stream Ecology (4 cr)

Biological and earth sciences elective, 3-4 Hours:

 Complete one from the following:

  • ENVS 309 - Geomorphology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 362 - Soil Science and Lab (4 cr)
  • GSCI 303 - Meteorology (4 cr)
  • GSCI 306 - Introduction to Oceanography and Laboratory (4 cr)
  • BIOL 302 - Microbiology (4 cr)
  • BIOL 305 - Cell Biology (4 cr)
  • BIOL 313 - Invertebrate Natural History (4 cr)
  • BIOL 315 - Plants and Humanity (4 cr)

  •  

  • BIOL 324 - Plant Taxonomy I Fall Flora (2 cr)
  • AND  BIOL 325 - Plant Taxonomy II Spring Flora (1 cr)

  •  

  • BIOL 332 - Comparative Anatomy (4 cr)
  • BIOL 344 - Genetics (4 cr)
  • BIOL 412 - Comparative Animal Physiology (4 cr)
  • BIOL 416 - Molecular Biology (4 cr)
  • BIOL 406 - Developmental Biology (4 cr)

Four-Year Course Progression

June 3, 2016             DEGREE TOTAL 120
         

 

Curriculum for a Comprehensive Major in Environmental Studies: Sustainable Agriculture and Resource Management, 75-82 Hours:

In addition to the Environmental Core and Portfolio Requirements, above, students will complete the following:

Additional Required Courses, 36-42 Hours:

  • GSCI 301 - Physical Geology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 300 - Integrated Pest Management and Lab (4 cr)
  • ENVS 301 - Wildlife Management and Lab (4 cr)
  • ENVS 306 - Environmental Policy (4cr)
  • ENVS 340 - Sustainable Agriculture and Lab (4 cr)
  • ENVS 362 - Soil Science and Lab (4 cr)
  • ENVS 390 - Geographic Information Systems (4 cr)
  • ENVS 401 - Conservation Ecology (4cr)
  • ENVS 461 - Environmental Research (1-6cr)

  •  

  • MATH 314 - Statistics (3 cr)
  • OR  MATH 207 - Calculus I (4 cr)

Elective Courses, 27-28 Hours:

Complementary Sciences, 8 Hours:

Choose one sequence:

  • BIOL 103 - General Biology (4 cr)
  • BIOL 104 - General Biology (4 cr)

  • OR

  • BIOL 211 - Fundamentals of Biology I: Molecular and Cellular Function (4cr)
  • BIOL 212 - Fundamentals of Biology II: Diversity of Life (4cr)

  • OR

  • CHEM 207 - General Chemistry I (3 cr)
  • CHEM 207L - General Chemistry I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • CHEM 209 - General Chemistry II (3 cr)
  • CHEM 209L - General Chemistry II Laboratory (1 cr)

  • OR

  • GSCI 103 - General Physical Science (4 cr)
  • GSCI 104 - General Physical Science (4 cr)

  • OR

  • PHYS 201 - College Physics I (3 cr)
  • PHYS 201L - College Physics I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • PHYS 202 - College Physics II (3 cr)
  • PHYS 202L - College Physics II Laboratory (1 cr)

  • OR

  • PHYS 221 - General Physics I (3 cr)
  • PHYS 221L - General Physics I Laboratory (1 cr)
  • PHYS 222 - General Physics II (3 cr)
  • PHYS 222L - General Physics II Laboratory (1 cr)

Environmental Biology Elective, 4 Hours:

Choose one:

  • ENVS 302 - Forestry Management and Laboratory (4 cr)
  • ENVS 343 - Aquatic Entomology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 344 - Ichthyology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 422 - Stream Ecology (4 cr)

Physical Elective, 4 Hours:

Choose one:

  • ENVS 309 - Geomorphology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 342 - Limnology (4 cr)
  • ENVS 441 - Hydrology and Lab (4 cr)
  • GSCI 303 - Meteorology (4 cr)
  • GSCI 306 - Introduction to Oceanography and Laboratory (4 cr)

Applied and Technical Electives, 7-8 Hours:

Choose two (no more than 1 course can be ACCT or BADM):

  • ENVS 345 - Sustainable Development and Laboratory (4 cr)
  • ENVS 396 - Photogrammetry and Aerial Systems (4 cr)
  • ENVS 397 - Advanced GIS and Remote Sensing (4cr)
  • PHYS 301 - Energy (4cr)
  • PHYS 302 - Physical Computing (4cr)
  • ACCT 201 - Principles of Financial Accounting I (3cr)
  • BADM 150 - Introduction to Business (3 cr)
  • BADM 311 - Exploring Entrepreneurship (3cr)
  • BADM 340 - Principles of Marketing (3cr)

Required Electives, 4 Hours:

  • Choose any 300-level or above BIOL, CHEM, ENVS, GSCI or PHYS courses (for a total of 4 credits). Exceptions are 392 co-op courses, WV Rocks courses for the RBA, BIOL 350, CHEM 325, CHEM 450, CHEM 490, and ENVS 461.

Four-Year Course Progression

2024-2025 Sustainable Ag/Resource Mgmt 4-Year Progression
